purpose: This document is the sole authoritative definition of internal rules for mbti_followup. It details the complete question bank for eight dimensions, scoring rules, and standard interpretation templates corresponding to scores.

testCoreLogic.title: Eight-Dimensional Reverse Ability Assessment
testCoreLogic.description: The system will select the four 'reverse' or 'shadow' dimension abilities for assessment based on the user's primary MBTI type.

questions.reverse_questions_text: After finishing a day's work, you tend to:

reverse_questions_options.A: Take a walk alone or read a book, organize your thoughts
reverse_questions_options.B: Go to social venues with colleagues to relax

questions.reverse_questions_text: When facing major decisions, you usually:

reverse_questions_options.A: First think deeply alone, write down key points
reverse_questions_options.B: Discuss with several people to gain inspiration

questions.reverse_questions_text: When you have no plans for the weekend, you will:

reverse_questions_options.A: Quietly spend time alone, recharge yourself
reverse_questions_options.B: Actively contact friends, arrange group activities

questions.reverse_questions_text: In unfamiliar team meetings, you are more likely to:

reverse_questions_options.A: Speak first, propose agenda
reverse_questions_options.B: Wait for others to speak, then supplement opinions

questions.reverse_questions_text: When attending large industry exhibitions, you usually:

reverse_questions_options.A: Actively socialize, exchange business cards
reverse_questions_options.B: Stay with acquaintances, avoid active socializing

questions.reverse_questions_text: When the team needs a host, you:

reverse_questions_options.A: Immediately volunteer to take on the role
reverse_questions_options.B: Hope others will take on the role, you cooperate

questions.reverse_questions_text: When making department quarterly plans, you will:

reverse_questions_options.A: First draft a five-year roadmap, then work backwards to this quarter's tasks
reverse_questions_options.B: First list tasks that can be executed now

questions.reverse_questions_text: When a new technology trend appears but data is insufficient, you are more likely to:

reverse_questions_options.A: Imagine future scenarios, plan ahead
reverse_questions_options.B: Wait for more empirical data before deciding whether to pivot

questions.reverse_questions_text: When facing a complex problem, you usually:

reverse_questions_options.A: First draw the overall structure, then break down details
reverse_questions_options.B: Start from the clearest details, gradually piece together

questions.reverse_questions_text: When starting a new project, you:

reverse_questions_options.A: Create detailed task lists and timelines
reverse_questions_options.B: First conduct free-wheeling brainstorming

questions.reverse_questions_text: When reading a professional article, you focus more on:

reverse_questions_options.A: Data and processes
reverse_questions_options.B: Theoretical frameworks and trends

questions.reverse_questions_text: Before traveling, you will:

reverse_questions_options.A: Check transportation, backup plans and print vouchers
reverse_questions_options.B: Only set general direction, adjust anytime

questions.reverse_questions_text: When a colleague is emotionally down, you are more likely to:

reverse_questions_options.A: Actively listen, show concern
reverse_questions_options.B: Propose solutions, return to work focus

questions.reverse_questions_text: When a friend confides worries, you usually:

reverse_questions_options.A: First empathize, acknowledge their feelings
reverse_questions_options.B: Immediately analyze reasons, give advice

questions.reverse_questions_text: When team conflicts intensify, you will:

reverse_questions_options.A: Focus on both sides' feelings, seek emotional reconciliation
reverse_questions_options.B: Focus on clarifying facts and logic

questions.reverse_questions_text: When asked to evaluate project feasibility, you first:

reverse_questions_options.A: Collect data, conduct cost-benefit analysis
reverse_questions_options.B: Feel the team atmosphere, then give intuitive judgment

questions.reverse_questions_text: In debates, you rely more on:

reverse_questions_options.A: Objective evidence and logical reasoning
reverse_questions_options.B: Personal values and human relationships

questions.reverse_questions_text: When needing to make choices, you:

reverse_questions_options.A: List pros and cons, quantify scoring
reverse_questions_options.B: Tend to follow feelings

questions.reverse_questions_text: When planning a long trip, you:

reverse_questions_options.A: Only book main transportation, details go with the flow
reverse_questions_options.B: Book flights and hotels in advance, prepare itinerary

questions.reverse_questions_text: When project progress is disrupted, you:

reverse_questions_options.A: Flexibly allocate resources, embrace changes
reverse_questions_options.B: Stick to original plan, try to catch up

questions.reverse_questions_text: When receiving urgent tasks, you:

reverse_questions_options.A: Quickly re-prioritize, allow original tasks to be delayed
reverse_questions_options.B: Try to complete everything within the original timeframe

questions.reverse_questions_text: For your weekly task list, you:

reverse_questions_options.A: Put each task in calendar and set reminders
reverse_questions_options.B: Keep in mind, don't make rigid arrangements

questions.reverse_questions_text: When the team needs process documentation, you:

reverse_questions_options.A: Actively write SOPs and track execution
reverse_questions_options.B: Explain verbally, avoid paperwork

questions.reverse_questions_text: When approaching deadlines, you:

reverse_questions_options.A: Set daily milestones, monitor progress
reverse_questions_options.B: Believe final sprint can handle it, don't break down tasks
